dialogues.text: Merci beaucoup. And here's a little  something for the effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch holds up a hundred dollar bill. Esmarelda's eyes light up. She goes to take it. Butch hol it out of reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now if anybody should ask you about  who your fare was tonight, what're  you gonna tell 'em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth. Three well-dressed,  slightly toasted, Mexicans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her the bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bon soir, Esmarelda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Sleep well, Butch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tweaks her nose, she smiles, and he turns and walks aw She drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch enters and turns on the light. Lying curled up on the bed, fully dressed, with her back us is Butch's French girlfriend, FABIENNE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep the light off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch flicks the switch back, making the room dark again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that better, sugar pop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oui. Hard day at the office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty hard. I got into a fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor baby. Can we make spoons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch climbs into bed, spooning Fabienne from behind. When Butch and Fabienne speak to each other, they speak i babytalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was looking at myself in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I had a pot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were lookin' in the mirror and  you wish you had some pot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pot. A pot belly. Pot bellies are  sexy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you should be happy, 'cause you  do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Fatso! I don't have a pot!  I have a bit of a tummy, like Madonna  when she did "Lucky Star," it's not  the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't realize there was a  difference between a tummy and a pot  belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The difference is huge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to have a pot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Pot bellies make a man look either  oafish, or like a gorilla. But on a  woman, a pot belly is very sexy. The  rest of you is normal. Normal face,  normal legs, normal hips, normal  ass, but with a big, perfectly round  pot belly. If I had one, I'd wear a  tee-shirt two sizes too small to  accentuate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think guys would find that  attractive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a damn what men find  attractive. It's unfortunate what we  find pleasing to the touch and  pleasing to the eye is seldom the  same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you a pot belly, I'd punch you in  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd punch me in my belly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right in the belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd smother you. I'd drop it on your  right on your face 'til you couldn't  breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd do that to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get everything, sugar pop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did everything go as planned?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't listen to the radio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never listen to your fights. Were  you the winner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you still retiring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the man you fought?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floyd retired too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Really?! He won't be fighting no  more?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it all worked out in the finish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ain't at the finish, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabienne rolls over and Butch gets on top of her. They ki

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in a lot of danger, aren't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch nods his head: "yes."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they find us, they'll kill us,  won't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch nods his head: "yes."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they won't find us, will they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch nods his head: "no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you still want me to go with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch nods his head: "yes."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be a burden or a  nuisance -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch's hand goes out of frame and starts massaging her  crotch. Fabienne reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabienne, I want you to be with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabienne lies her head back. Butch continues to massage her crotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you love me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oui.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch? Will you give me oral pleasure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch kisses her on the mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you kiss it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods her head: "yes."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch's head goes down out of frame to carry out the oral pleasure. Fabienne's face is alone in the frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in French, with  English subtitles) Butch my love, the adventure begins.

dialogues.speaker: MOTEL ROOM
dialogues.text: Same motel room, except empty. WE HEAR THE SHOWER RUNNING the bathroom. The CAMERA MOVES to the bathroom doorway. W see Fabienne in a white terry cloth robe that seems to sw her up. She's drying her head with a towel. Butch is inside the s washing up. We see the outline of his naked body through smoky glass of the shower door. Steam fills the bathroom. Butch turns the shower off and opens the door, popping hi head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I cracked a rib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giving me oral pleasure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No retard, from the fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call me retard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a Mongoloid voice) My name is Fabby! My name is Fabby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up fuck head! I hate that  Mongoloid voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, sorry, sorry, sorry, I take it  back!  Can I have a towel please,  Miss Beautiful Tulip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I like that, I like being called  a tulip. Tulip is much better than  Mongoloid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finishes drying her hair and wraps the towel like a t on her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't call you a Mongoloid, I  called you a retard, but I took it  back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him a towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merci beaucoup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drying his head) Yes, lemon pie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure yet. Wherever you want.  We're gonna get a lot of money from  this. But it ain't gonna be so much,  we can live like hogs in the fat  house forever. I was thinking we  could go somewhere in the South  Pacific. The kinda money we'll have'll  carry us a long way down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if we wanted, we could live in  Bora Bora?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You betcha. And if after awhile you  don't dig Bora Bora, then we can  move over to Tahiti or Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I do not speak Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't speak Bora Boran either. Besides, Mexican is easy: Donde esta  el zapataria?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the shoe store?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donde esta el zapataria?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent pronunciation. You'll be  my little mama ceta in no time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch exits the bathroom. We stay on Fabienne as she brus her teeth. Butch keeps on from the other room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Que hora es?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Que hora es?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time for bed. Sweet dream, jellybean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabienne brushes her teeth. We watch her for a moment or  two, then she remember something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks out of the bathroom to ask Butch a question, on to find him sound asleep in bed. She looks at him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She exits frame, going back in the bathroom. WE STAY on t WIDE SHOT of the unconscious Butch in bed.

dialogues.speaker: MOTEL ROOM
dialogues.text: SAME SHOT AS BEFORE, the next morning. We find Butch stil asleep in bed. Fabienne brushes her teeth half in and half out of the  bathroom so she can watch TV at the same time. She still  wears the terry cloth robe from the night before. ON TV: WILLIAM SMITH and a BUNCH OF HELL'S ANGELS are tak on the entire Vietnamese army in the film "THE LOSERS". Butch wakes from his sleep, as if a scary monster was cha him. His start startles Fabienne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merde! You startled me. Did you have  a bad dream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch squints down the front of the bed at her, trying to focus. Butch, still trying to chase the cobwebs away, sees on TV Hell's Angels tear-assin' through a Vietnamese prison cam

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you watching?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A motorcycle movie, I'm not sure the  name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you watchin' it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabienne enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a way. Why? Would you like for me  to switch it off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches over and turns off the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a little too early in the morning  for explosions and war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How should I know, you were the one  watchin' it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabienne laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, imbecile, what was your dream  about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I... don't remember. It's really  rare I remember a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just woke up from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabienne, I'm not lying to you, I  don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's look at the grumpy man  in the morning. I didn't say you  were lying, it's just odd you don't  remember your dreams. I always  remember mine. Did you know you talk  in your sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't talk in my sleep, do I talk  in my sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laying on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I couldn't understand  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses Butch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you get up and we'll get  some breakfast at that breakfast  place with the pancakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more kiss and I'll get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabienne gives Butch a sweet long kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satisfied?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get up, lazy bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch climbs out of bed and starts pulling clothes out of the suitcase that Fabienne brought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost nine in the morning. What  time does our train arrive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna order a big plate of  blueberry pancakes with maple syrup,  eggs over easy, and five sausages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised at her  potential appetite) Anything to drink with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch is finished dressing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to his  clothes) Oh yes, that looks nice. To drink, a  tall glass or orange juice and a  black cup of coffee. After that, I'm  going to have a slice of pie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he goes through the suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pie for breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any time of the day is a good time  for pie. Blueberry pie to go with  the pancakes. And on top, a thin  slice of melted cheese В–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В– where's my watch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not. It's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you looked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By now, Butch is frantically rummaging through the suitca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I've fuckin' looked!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's now throwing clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck do you think I'm doing?!  Are you sure you got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabienne can hardly speak, she's never seen Butch this wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhhh... yes... beside the table drawer  В–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В– on the little kangaroo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it was on your little kangaroo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it's not here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the verge of tears) Well it should be!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh it most definitely should be here,  but it's not. So where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabienne is crying and scared. Butch lowers his voice, which only serves to make him mor menacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabienne, that was my father's fuckin'  watch. You know what my father went  through to git me that watch?... I  don't wanna get into it right now...  but he went through a lot. Now all  this other shit, you coulda set on  fire, but I specifically reminded  you not to forget my father's watch.  Now think, did you get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You believe so? You either did, or  you didn't, now which one is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch freaks out, he punches the air. Fabienne SCREAMS and backs into a corner, Butch picks up motel TV and THROWS IT AGAINST the wall. Fabienne SCREAMS IN HORROR. Butch looks toward her, suddenly calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Fabienne) No! It's not your fault. (he approached her) You left it at the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bends down in front of the woman who has sunk to the f He touches her hand, she flinches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you did leave it at the apartment,  it's not your fault. I had you bring  a bunch of stuff. I reminded you  about it, but I didn't illustrate  how personal the watch was to me. If  all I gave a fuck about was my watch,  I should've told you. You ain't a  mind reader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her hand. Then rises. Fabienne is still sniffling. Butch goes to the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch puts on his high school jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be. It just means I won't be  able to eat breakfast with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does it mean that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm going back to my apartment  to get my watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't the gangsters be looking for  you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm gonna find out. If  they are, and I don't think I can  handle it, I'll split.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rising from the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was so dreadful. I saw your watch,  I thought I brought it. I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch brings her close and puts his hands on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't feel bad, sugar pop. Nothing  you could ever do would make me  permanently angry at you. (pause) I love you, remember? (he digs some money  out of his wallet) Now here's some money, order those  pancakes and have a great breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back before you can say,  blueberry pie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blueberry pie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well maybe not that fast, but fast.  Okay?  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her once more and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye-bye, sugar pop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna take your Honda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, he's out the door. Fabienne sits on the bed and looks at the money he gave h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch is beating the steering wheel and the dash with his fists as he drives down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of all the fuckin' things she coulda  forgot, she forgets my father's watch.  I specifically reminded her not to  forget it. "Bedside table В– on the  kangaroo." I said the words: "Don't  forget my father's watch."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little Honda races toward its destination as fast as little engine will take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A parking meter red flag rises up, then out, leaving the  arrow pointing at one hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch isn't completely reckless. He has parked his car a  couple of blocks from his apartment to check things out b he goes boppin' through the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch walks down the alley until he gets to another stree then he discreetly glances out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything seems normal. More or less the right number of cars in the street. None of the parked cars appear out of place. None of them have a couple of goons sitting inside Basically, it looks like normal morning activity in front Butch's home. Butch peers around a wall, taking in the vital informatio Butch walks out of the alley and is ready for anything. H crosses the street and enters his apartment courtyard. Across the street from Butch's building, on the corner, i combination donut shop and Japanese restaurant. A big sig sticks up in the air, with the name "Teriyaki Donut" and graphic of a donut sticking out of a bowl of rice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch is in the courtyard of his North Hollywood apartmen building. Once again, everything appears normal В– the la room, the pool, his apartment door В– nothing appears  disturbed. Butch climbs the stairs leading to his apartment, number He steps outside the door and listens inside. Nothing. Butch slowly inserts the key into the door, quietly openi it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His apartment hasn't been touched. He cautiously steps inside, shuts the door and takes a qu look around. Obviously, no one is there. Butch walks into his modest kitchen, and opens the  refrigerator. He takes out a carton of milk and drinks from it. With carton in hard, Butch surveys the apartment. Then he goes to the bedroom. His bedroom is like the rest of the apartment В– neat, cl and anonymous. The only things personal in his room are a few boxing trophies, an Olympic silver medal, a framed is of "Ring Magazine" with Butch on the cover, and a poster Jerry Quarry and one of George Chuvalo. Sure enough, there's the watch just like he said it was: the bedside table, hanging on his little kangaroo statue. He walks through the apartment and back into the kitchen. opens a cupboard and takes out a box of Pop Tarts. Puttin down the milk, he opens the box, takes out two Pop Tarts puts them in the toaster. Butch glances to his right, his eyes fall on something. What he sees is a small compact Czech M61 submachine gun  with a huge silencer on it, lying on his kitchen counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up the intimidating peace of weaponry and examin it. Then... a toilet FLUSHES. Butch looks up to the bathroom door, which is parallel to the kitchen. There is someone behind it. Like a rabbit caught in a radish patch, Butch freezes, no knowing what to do. The bathroom door opens and Vincent Vega steps out of the bathroom, tightening his belt. In his hand is the book  "MODESTY BLAISE" by Peter O'Donnell. Vincent and Butch lock eyes. Vincent freezes. Butch doesn't move, except to point the M61 in Vincent's  direction. Neither man opens his mouth. Then... the toaster LOUDLY kicks up the Pop Tarts. That's all the situation needed. Butch's finger HITS the trigger. MUFFLED FIRE SHOOTS out of the end of the gun. Vincent is seemingly WRACKED with twenty bullets  SIMULTANEOUSLY В– LIFTING him off his feet, PROPELLING hi through the air and CRASHING through the glass shower doo at the end of the bathroom. By the time Butch removes his finger from the trigger, Vi is annihilated. Butch stands frozen, amazed at what just happened. His lo goes from the grease spot in the bathroom that was once  Vincent, down to the powerful piece of artillery in his g With the respect it deserves, Butch carefully places the back on the kitchen counter. Then he exits the apartment, quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch, not running, but walking very rapidly, crosses the courtyard... ...comes out of the apartment building, crosses the stree ...goes through the alley... ...and into his car in one STEADICAM SHOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch CRANKS the car into gear and drives away. The big w smile of a survivor breaks across his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Honda turns down the alley and slowly cruises by his  apartment building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch looks out the window at his former home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how you're gonna beat 'em,  Butch.  They keep underestimatin'  ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This makes the boxer laugh out loud. As he laughs, he fli a tape in the cassette player. When the MUSIC starts, he  SINGS along with it. He drives by the apartment, but is stopped at the light o the corner across from Teriyaki Donut. Butch is still chuckling, singing along with the song, as see:

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD
dialogues.text: The big man himself, Marsellus Wallace, exit Teriyaki Don carrying a box of a dozen donuts and two large styrofoam  cups of coffee. He steps off the curb, crossing the stree in front of Butch's car. This is the first time we see  Marsellus clearly. Laughing boy stops when he sees the big man directly in f of him. When Marsellus is in front of Butch's car, he casually gl to his left, sees Butch, continues walking... then STOPS! DOUBLE-TAKE: "Am I really seeing what I'm seeing?" Butch doesn't wait for the big man to answer his own ques He STOMPS on the gas pedal. The little Honda SLAMS into Marsellus, sending him, the d and the coffee HITTING the pavement at thirty miles an ho Butch CUTS into cross traffic and is BROAD-SIDED by a gol Camaro Z-28, BREAKING all the windows in the Honda and se it up on the sidewalk. Butch sits dazed and confused in the crumpled mess of wha at one time was Fabienne's Honda. Blood flows from his  nostrils. The still-functional tape player continues to p A PEDESTRIAN pokes his head inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch look at him, spaced-out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marsellus Wallace lies sprawled out in the street. GAWKER gather around the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the others) He's dead! He's dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This jerk's yelling makes Marsellus come to. TWO PEDESTRIANS help the shaken Butch out of the wreckage The woozy Marsellus gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you need a witness in court, I'll  be glad to help. He was a drunken  maniac. He hit you and crashed into  that car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still incoherent) Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at Butch) Him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marsellus follows the Gawker's finger and sees Butch Cool down the street, looking a shambles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll be damned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big man takes out a .45 Automatic and the Gawkers bac away. Marsellus starts moving toward Butch. Butch sees the fierce figure making a wobbly bee-line tow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sacre bleu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marsellus brings up his weapon and FIRES, but he's so hur shaky and dazed that his arm goes wild. He HITS a LOOKY-LOO WOMAN in the hip. She falls to the gr screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, I've been shot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all Butch needs to see. He's outta here. Marsellus RUNS after him. The CROWD looks agape. Butch is in a mad, limping RUN. The big man's hot on his ass with a cockeyed wobbly run. Butch cuts across traffic and dashes into a business with sign that reads "MASON-DIXIE PAWNSHOP".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAYNARD, a hillbilly-lookin' boy, stands behind the count of his pawnshop when, all of a sudden, chaos in the form Butch RACES into his world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you wit' somethin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch quickly takes measure of the situation, than stands next to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you just wait one goddamn minute  В–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Maynard can finish his threat, Marsellus CHARGES i He doesn't get past the doorway because Butch LANDS his f in Marsellus' face. The gangster's feet go out from under him and the big man FALLS FLAT on his back. Outside, two police cars with their SIRENS BLARING race b Butch POUNCES on the fallen body, PUNCHING him twice more the face. Butch takes the gun out of Marsellus' hand, than grabs ah of his middle finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you like chasing people, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He BREAKS the finger. Marsellus lets out a pain sound.  B then places the barrel of the .45 between his eyes, PULLS back the hammer and places his open hand behind the gun t shield the splatter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well guess what, big man, you caught  me В–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В– hold it right there, godammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch and Marsellus look up at Maynard, who's brandishing pumpaction shotgun, aimed at the two men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look mister, this ain't any of your  business В–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В– I'm makin' it my business! Now  toss that gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you on top, stand up and come to  the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch slowly gets up and moves to the counter. As soon as gets there, Maynard HAULS OFF, HITTING him hard in the fa with the butt of the shotgun, knocking Butch down and out After Butch goes down, Maynard calmly lays the shotgun on the counter and moves to the telephone. Marsellus Wallace, from his position on the floor, groggi watches the pawnshop owner dial a number. Maynard waits o the line while the other end rings. Then it picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zed? It's Maynard. The spider just  caught a coupl'a flies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marsellus passes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are tied up in two separate chairs. In their mouths two S&M-style ball gags (a belt goes around their hea a little red ball sticks in their mouths). Both men are  unconscious. Maynard steps in with a fire extinguisher and SPRAYS both guys until they're wide awake and wet as otters. The two  prisoners look up at their captors. Maynard stands in front of them, fire extinguisher in one hand, shotgun in the other, and Marsellus' .45 sticking i his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody kills anybody in my place of  business except me or Zed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BUZZER buzzes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Zed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without saying another word, Maynard climbs up the stairs that lead to red curtains and goes through them. WE HEAR, on the other side of the curtains, Maynard let Z inside the store. Butch and Marsellus look around the room. The basement of the pawnshop has been converted into a dungeon. After tak in their predicament, Butch and Marsellus look at each ot all traces of hostility gone, replaced by a terror they b share at what they've gotten themselves into. Maynard and ZED come through the curtains. Zed is an even more intense version of Maynard, if such a thing is possi The two hillbillys are obviously brothers. Where Maynard a vicious pitbull, Zed is a deadly cobra. Zed walks in an stands in front of the two captives. He inspects them for long time, then says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Maynard) You said you waited for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how come they're all beat up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They did that to each other. They  was fightin' when they came in. This  one was gonna shoot that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Butch) You were gonna shoot him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch makes no reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, is Grace gonna be okay in front  of this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it ain't Tuesday is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's Thursday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring out The Gimp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think The Gimp's sleepin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess you'll just wake 'em  up then, won't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maynard opens a trap door in the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling in the hole) Wake up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maynard reaches into the hole and comes back holding onto leash. He gives it a rough yank and, from below the floor, rises THE GIMP. The Gimp is a man they keep dressed from head to toe in b leather bondage gear. There are zippers, buckles and stud here and there on the body. On his head is a black leathe mask with two eye holes and a zipper (closed) for a mouth They keep him in a hole in the floor big enough for a lar dog. Zed takes the chair, sits it in front of the two prisoner then lowers into it. Maynard hands The Gimp's leash to Ze then backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to The Gimp) Down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gimp gets on its knees. Maynard hangs back while Zed appraises the two men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't fer sure yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then with his little finger, Zed does a silent "Eenie, me miney, moe... " just his mouth mouthing the words and his finger going back and forth between the two. Butch are Marsellus are terrified. Maynard looks back and forth at the victims. The Gimps's eyes go from one to the other inside the mask Zed continues his silent sing-song with his finger moving left to right, then it stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a beat, THE CAMERA MOVES to the right, zeroing in o Marsellus. Zed stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna do it here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, drag big boy to Russell's old  room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zed grabs Marsellus' chair and DRAGS him into Russell's o room. Russell, no doubt, was some other poor bastard that has t misfortune of stumbling into the Mason-Dixie pawnshop.  Whatever happened to Russell is known only to Maynard and Zed because his old room, a back room in the back of the  back room, is empty. As Marsellus is dragged away, he locks eyes with Butch be he disappears behind the door of Russell's old room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to The Gimp) Up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gimp rises. Maynard ties The Gimp's leash to a hook o the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep an eye on this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gimp bows its head: "yes." Maynard disappears into  Russell's old room. There must be a stereo in there becau suddenly The Judds, singing in harmony, fills the air. Butch looks at The Gimp. The Gimp giggles from underneath the mask as if this were the funniest moment in the histo of comedy. From behind the door we hear country MUSIC, struggling, a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, this boy's got a bit of fight  in 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We the HEAR Maynard and Zed beat on Marsellus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna fight? You wanna fight?  Good, I like to fight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch pauses, listens to the voices. Then, in a panic,  hurriedly struggles to get free. The Gimp is laughing wildly. The ropes are on too tight and Butch can't break free. The Gimp slaps his knee laughing In the back room, we hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it... that's it boy, you're  goin' fine. Oooooooh, just like  that... that's good. (grunting faster) Stay still... stay still goddamn ya!  Zed goddammit, git over here and  hold 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch stops struggling and lifts up on his arms. Then, qu easily, the padded chair back slides up and off as if it  were never connected by a bolt. The Gimp sees this and its eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huhng?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gimp FLAILS WILDLY, trying to get the leash off the h He tries to yell, but all that comes out are excited gurg and grunts. Butch is out of his chair, quickly dispensing three BOXER PUNCHES to its face. The punches knock The Gimp out, maki him fall to his knees, this HANGING HIMSELF by the leash  attached to the hook, Butch removes the ball gag, then  silently makes his way through the red curtains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch sneaks to the door. On the counter is a big set of keys with a large Z connec to the ring. Grabbing them, he's about to go out when he  stops and listens to the hillbilly psychopaths having the way with Marsellus. Butch decides for the life of him, he can't leave anybody a situation like that. Se he begins rooting around the  pawnshop for a weapon to bash those hillbillies' heads in with. He picks up a big destructive-looking hammer, then discar it: Not destructive enough. He picks up a chainsaw, think about it for a moment, then puts it back. Next, a large  Louisville slugger he tries on for size. But then he spot what he's been looking for: A Samurai sword. It hands in its hand-carved wood sheath from a nail on th wall, next to a neon "DAD'S OLD-FASHIONED ROOT BEER" sign Butch takes the sword off the wall, removing it from its  sheath. It's a magnificent piece of steel. It seems to gl in the low-wattage light of the pawnshop. Butch touches h thumb to the blade to see if the sword is just for show. on your life. It's as sharp as it gets. This weapon seems made to order for the Brothers Grimm downstairs. Holding sword pointed downward, Takakura Kenstyle, he disappears  through the red curtains to take care of business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch quietly sneaks down the stairs leading to the dunge Sodomy and the Judds can still be heard going string behi the closed door that leads to Russell's old room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch's hand comes into frame, pushing the door open. It  swings open silently, revealing the rapists, who have swi positions. Zed is now bent over Marsellus, who is bent over a wooden horse. Maynard watches. Both have their backs to Butch. Maynard faces the CAMERA, grinning, while Butch comes up  behind him with the sword. Miserable, violated, and looking like a rag doll, Marsell red ball gag still in mouth, opens his watery eyes to see Butch coming up behind Maynard. His eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey hillbilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maynard turns and sees Butch holding the sword. Butch SCREAMS... with one mighty SWING, SLASHES Maynard a the front, moving past him, eyes and blade now locked on  Zed. Maynard stands trembling, his front sliced open, in shock Butch, while never taking his eyes off Zed, THRUSTS the s behind him, SKEWERING Maynard, then EXTRACTS it, pointing the blade toward Zed. Maynard COLLAPSES. Zed disengages from Marsellus in a hurry and his eyes go  from the tip of Butch's sword to Marsellus' .45 Automatic which lies within reach. Butch's eyes follow Zed's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want that gun, Zed? Pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zed's hand inches toward the weapon. Butch GRIPS the sword tighter. Zed studies Butch. Butch looks hard at Zed. Then a VOICE says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step aside, Butch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch steps aside, REVEALING Marsellus standing behind hi holding Maynard's pump-action shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: KABOOM
dialogues.text: Zed is BLASTED in the groin. Down he goes, SCREAMING in A Marsellus, looking down at his whimpering rapist, EJECTS used shotgun shell. Butch lowers the sword and hangs back. Not a word, until:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw man. I'm pretty fuckin' far from  okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now? Well let me tell you what  now.  I'm gonna call a couple pipe- hittin' niggers, who'll go to work  on homes here with a pair of pliers  and a blow torch. (to Zed) Hear me talkin' hillbilly boy?! I  ain't through with you by a damn  sight. I'm gonna git Medieval on  your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant what now, between me and  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that what now? Well, let me tell  ya what now between me an' you. There  is no me an' you. Not no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we're cool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah man, we're cool. One thing I  ask В– two things I ask: Don't tell  nobody about this. This shit's between  me and you and the soon-to-be-livin'- the-rest-of-his-short-ass-life-in- agonizing-pain, Mr. Rapist here. It  ain't nobody else's business. Two:  leave town. Tonight. Right now. And  when you're gone, stay gone.  You've  lost your Los Angeles privileges.   Deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men shake hands, then hug one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on now, get your ass outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch leaves Russell's old room through the red curtains. Marsellus walks over to a phone, dialing a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Hello Mr. Wolf, it's Marsellus. Gotta  bit of a situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch, still shaking in his boots, exits the pawnshop. He looks ahead and sees, parked in front of the establishmen Zed's Big Chrome Chopper with a teardrop gas tank that ha the name "GRACE" on it. He climbs aboard, takes out the k with the big Z on them and starts up the huge hog. It RUM to life, making sounds like a rocket fighting for orbit.  Butch twists the accelerator handle and SPEEDS off. WE CUT BACK AND FORTH BETWEEN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabienne stands in front of a mirror wearing a "Frankie s Relax" tee-shirt, singing along with MUSIC coming from a  BOOM BOX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch drives down the street, humping a hot hog named "GR He checks his father's watch. It says: 10:30. The SONG in the motel room PLAYS OVER this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch rides up on Grace. He hops off and runs inside the  motel room, while we stay outside with the bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch, I was so worried!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, grab your radio and your purse  and let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about all our bags?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the bags. We'll miss our train  if we don't split now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything well? Are we in danger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're cool. In fact, we're super- cool. But we gots to go. I'll wait  for you outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch runs out and hops back on the bike. Fabienne exits motel room with the boom box and a large purse. When she  sees Butch on the chopper, she stops dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get this motorcycle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he kick-starts it) It's a chopper, baby, hop on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabienne slowly approaches the two-wheel demon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to my Honda?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry baby, I crashed the Honda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might've broke my nose, no biggie.  Hop on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't move. Butch looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, we gotta hit the fuckin' road!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabienne starts to cry. Butch realizes that this is not the way to get her on the bike. He turns off the engine and reaches out, taking her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, baby-love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) You were gone so long, I started to  think dreadful thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I worried you, sweetie. Everything's fine. Hey, how was  breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waterworks drying a  little) It was good В–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В– did you get the blueberry pancakes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they didn't have blueberry  pancakes, I had to get buttermilk В–  are you sure you're okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby-love, from the moment I left  you, this has been without a doubt  the single weirdest day of my entire  life. Climb on an' I'll tell ya about  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabienne does climb on. Butch STARTS her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch, whose motorcycle is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose chopper is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zed's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Zed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zed's dead, baby, Zed's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, the two lovebirds PEEL AWAY on Grace, as t SONG on the BOOM BOX RISES.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE CARD
dialogues.text: "JULES VINCENT JIMMIE & THE WOLF"

dialogues.speaker: TITLE DISAPPEARS.
dialogues.text: Over black, we can HEAR in the distance, men talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever read the Bible, Brett?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a passage I got memorized,  seems appropriate for this situation:  Ezekiel 25:17. "The path of the  righteous man is beset on all sides  by the inequities of the selfish and  the tyranny of evil men..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in the bathroom of the Hollywood apartment we were earlier. In fact, we're there at exactly the same time. E this time, we're in the bathroom with the FOURTH MAN. The Fourth Man is pacing around the small room, listening har to what's being said on the other side of the door, tight CLUTCHING his huge silver .357 Magnum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...blessed is he who, in the name  of charity and good will, shepherded  the weak through the valley of  darkness. And I will strike down  upon thee with great vengeance and  furious anger those who attempt to  poison and destroy my brothers. And  you will know I am the Lord when I  lay my vengeance upon you."

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: The Fourth Man freaks out. He THROWS himself against the  back wall, gun outstretched in front of him, a look of ye fear on his face, ready to blow in half anybody fool enou to stick their head through that door. Then he listens to them talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friend of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Marvin-Vincent-Vincent-Marvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting for them isn't the smartest move. Bursting out th door and blowing them all away while they're fuckin' arou is the way to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bathroom door BURSTS OPEN and the Fourth Man CHARGES  out, silver Magnum raised, FIRING SIX BOOMING SHOTS from hand cannon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Die... die... die... die...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOLLY INTO Fourth Man, same as before. He SCREAM until he's dry firing. Then a look of confusion crosses his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing next to each other, unharmed. Amazing as it seem none of the Fourth Man's shots appear to have hit anybody Jules and Vincent exchange looks like, "Are we hit?" They as confused at the shooter. After looking at each other,  they bring their looks up to the Fourth Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand В–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fourth Man is taken out of the scenario by the two me bullets who, unlike his, HIT their marks. He drops DEAD. The two men lower their guns. Jules, obviously shaken, si down in a chair. Vincent, after a moment of respect, shru it off. Then heads toward Marvin in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the fuck didn't you tell us about  that guy in the bathroom? Slip your  mind?  Forget he was in there with a  goddamn hand cannon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) We should be fuckin' dead right now. (pause) Did you see that gun he fired at us?  It was bigger than him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should be fuckin' dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we were lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules rises, moving toward Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That shit wasn't luck. That shit was  somethin' else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent prepares to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was... divine intervention. You  know what divine intervention is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think so. That means God  came down from Heaven and stopped  the bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, man, that's what is means.  That's exactly what it means! God  came down from Heaven and stopped  the bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should be going now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do that! Don't you fuckin' do  that!  Don't blow this shit off!  What just happened was a fuckin'  miracle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chill the fuck out, Jules, this shit  happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong, wrong, this shit doesn't just  happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you wanna continue this theological  discussion in the car, or at the  jailhouse with the cops?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should be fuckin' dead now, my  friend!  We just witnessed a miracle,  and I want you to fuckin' acknowledge  it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay man, it was a miracle, can we  leave now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chevy Nova PROPELS itself into traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules is behind the wheel,Vincent in the passenger seat a Marvin in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Ever seen that show "COPS?"  I  was watchin' it once and this cop  was on it who was talkin' about this  time he got into this gun fight with  a guy in a hallway. He unloads on  this guy and he doesn't hit anything.  And these guys were in a hallway.  It's a freak, but it happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you wanna play blind man, then go  walk with a Shepherd. But me, my  eyes are wide fuckin' open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it for me. For here on in,  you can consider my ass retired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't blaspheme!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Jules В–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В– I said don't do that В–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В– you're fuckin' freakin' out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tellin' Marsellus today I'm  through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While you're at it, be sure to tell  'im why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet ya ten thousand dollars, he  laughs his ass off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a damn if he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent turns to the backseat with the .45 casually in hi grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin, what do you make of all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even have an opinion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Marvin. Do you think God came  down from Heaven and stopped the  bullets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent's .45 goes BANG! Marvin is hit in the upper chest, below the throat. He GU blood and SHAKES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just accidentally shot Marvin in  the throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the fuck did you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to do it. I said it  was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen a lot of crazy-ass shit in  my time В–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В– chill out, man, it was an accident,  okay? You hit a bump or somethin'  and the gun went off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car didn't hit no motherfuckin'  bump!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look! I didn't mean to shoot this  son-ofa-bitch, the gun just went  off, don't ask me how!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this mess! We're drivin'  around on a city street in broad  daylight В–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В– I know, I know, I wasn't thinkin'  about the splatter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you better be thinkin' about it  now, motherfucker! We gotta get this  car off the road. Cops tend to notice  shit like you're driving a car  drenched in fuckin' blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we just take it to a friendly  place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Valley, Vincent. Marsellus  don't got no friendly places in the  Valley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't look at me, this is your  town, Jules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules takes out a cellular phone and starts punching digi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who ya callin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A buddy of mine in Toluca Lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Toluca Lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the other side of the hill, by  Burbank Studios. If Jimmie's ass  ain't home, I don't know what the  fuck we're gonna go. I ain't got any  other partners in 818. (into phone) Jimmie! How you doin' man, it's Jules. (pause) Listen up man, me an' my homeboy are  in some serious shit. We're in a car  we gotta get off the road, pronto! I  need to use your garage for a couple  hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules is bent over a sink, washing his bloody hands while Vincent stands behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta be real fuckin' delicate  with this Jimmie's situation. He's  one remark away from kickin' our  asses out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he kicks us out, whadda we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we ain't leavin' 'til we made  a couple phone calls. But I never  want it to reach that pitch. Jimmie's  my friend and you don't bust in your  friend's house and start tellin' 'im  what's what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules rises and dries his hands. Vincent takes his place the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell 'im not to be abusive. He  kinda freaked out back there when he  saw Marvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put yourself in his position. It's  eight o'clock in the morning. He  just woke up, he wasn't prepared for  this shit. Don't forget who's doin'  who a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent finishes, then dries his hands on a white towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the price of that favor is I gotta  take shit, he can stick his favor  straight up his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Vincent is finished drying his hands, the towel is  stained with red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck did you just do to his  towel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just dryin' my hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're supposed to wash 'em first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You watched me wash 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I watched you get 'em wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I washed 'em. Blood's real hard to  get off. Maybe if he had some Lava,  I coulda done a better job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used the same soap you did and  when I dried my hands, the towel  didn't look like a fuckin' Maxie  pad. Look, fuck it, alright. Who  cares? But it's shit like this that's  gonna bring this situation to a boil.  If he were to come in here and see  that towel like that... I'm tellin'  you Vincent, you best be cool. 'Cause  if I gotta get in to it with Jimmie  on account of you... Look, I ain't  threatenin' you, I respect you an'  all, just don't put me in that  position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules, you ask me nice like that, no  problem. He's your friend, you handle  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three men are standing in Jimmie's kitchen, each with a m of coffee. Jules, Vincent and JIMMIE DIMMICK, a young man his late 20s dressed in a bathrobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn Jimmie, this is some serious  gourmet shit. Me an' Vincent woulda  been satisfied with freeze-dried  Tasters Choice. You spring this  gourmet fuckin' shit on us. What  flavor is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock it off, Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a cobb or corn, so you can  stop butterin' me up. I don't need  you to tell me how good my coffee  is. I'm the one who buys it, I know  how fuckin' good it is.  When Bonnie  goes shoppin;, she buys shit.  I buy  the gourmet expensive stuff 'cause  when I drink it, I wanna taste it.  But what's on my mind at this moment  isn't the coffee in my kitchen, it's  the dead nigger in my garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmie В–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В– I'm talkin'. Now let me ask you a  question, Jules. When you drove in  here, did you notice a sign out front  that said, "Dead nigger storage?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules starts to "Jimmie" him В–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В– answer to question. Did you see a  sign out in front of my house that  said, "Dead nigger storage?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playing along) Naw man, I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why you didn't see that  sign?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause storin' dead niggers ain't my  fuckin' business!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules starts to "Jimmie" him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В– I ain't through! Now don't you  understand that if Bonnie comes home  and finds a dead body in her house,  I'm gonna get divorced. No marriage  counselor, no trial separation В–  fuckin' divorced. And I don't wanna  get fuckin' divorced. The last time  me an' Bonnie talked about this shit  was gonna be the last time me an'  Bonnie talked about this shit. Now I  wanna help ya out Julie, I really  do. But I ain't gonna lose my wife  doin' it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmie В–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В– don't fuckin' Jimmie me, man, I  can't be Jimmied. There's nothin'  you can say that's gonna make me  forget I love my wife. Now she's  workin' the graveyard shift at the  hospital. She'll be comin' home in  less than an hour and a half. Make  your phone calls, talk to your people,  than get the fuck out of my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all we want. We don't wanna  fuck up your shit. We just need to  call our people to bring us in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I suggest you get to it. Phone's  in my bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marsellus Wallace sits at his dining table in a big comfy robe, eating his large breakfast, while talking on the ph

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...well, say she comes home. Whaddya  think she'll do? (pause) No fuckin' shit she'll freak. That  ain't no kinda answer. You know 'er,  I don't.  How bad, a lot or a little?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules paces around in Jimmie's bedroom on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to appreciate what an  explosive element this Bonnie  situation is. If she comes home from  a hard day's work and finds a bunch  of gangsters doin' a bunch of gangsta'  shit in her kitchen, ain't no tellin'  what she's apt to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've grasped that, Jules. All I'm  doin' is contemplating the "ifs."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna hear about no  motherfuckin' "ifs."What I wanna  hear from your ass is: "you ain't  got no problems, Jules. I'm on the  motherfucker. Go back in there, chill  them niggers out and wait for the  cavalry, which should be comin'  directly."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't got no problems, Jules.  I'm on the motherfucker. Go back in  there, chill them niggers out and  wait for The Wolf, who should be  comin' directly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sendin' The Wolf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit Negro, that's all you had to  say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA looks through the bedroom doorway of a hotel s into the main area. We SEE a crap game being played on a  fancy crap table by GAMBLERS in tuxedos and LUCKY LADIES fancy evening gowns. The CAMERA PANS to the right reveali Sitting on a bed, phone in hand with his back to us, the  tuxedo-clad WINSTON WOLF aka "THE WOLF". We also see The  Wolf has a small notepad that he jots details in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Is she the hysterical type? (pause) When she due? (jotting down) Give me the principals' names again? (jots down) Jules...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We SEE his book. The page has written on it: "1265 Riverside Drive Toluca Lake 1 body (no head)  Bloody shot-up car Jules (black)"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Vincent... Jimmie... Bonnie...

dialogues.speaker: HE WRITES
dialogues.text: "Vincent (Dean Martin) Jimmie (house) Bonnie (9:30)"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Expect a call around 10:30. It's  about thirty minutes away. I'll be  there in ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up. We never see his face.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE CARD OVER BLACK
dialogues.text: "NINE MINUTES AND THIRTY-SEVEN SECONDS LATER"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A silver Porsche WHIPS the corner leading to Jimmie's hom in HYPER DRIVE. Easily doing 135 mph, the Porsche stops o dime in front of Jimmie's house. A ringed finger touches the doorbell: DING DONG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmie opens the door. We see, standing in the doorway, t tuxedo-clad man. He looks down to his notebook, then up a Jimmie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Jimmie, right? This is your  house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stick his hand out) I'm Winston Wolf, I solve problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, 'cause we got one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I heard. May I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dining room, Jules and Vincent stand up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be Jules, which would make  you Vincent. Let's get down to brass  tacks, gentlemen. If I was informed  correctly, the clock is ticking, is  that right, Jimmie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wife, Bonnie... (refers to his pad) ...comes home at 9:30 in the AM, is  that correct?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was led to believe if she comes  home and finds us here, she wouldn't  appreciate it none too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She won't at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That gives us forty minutes to get  the fuck outta Dodge, which, if you  do what I say when I say it, should  by plenty. Now you got a corpse in a  car, minus a head, in a garage. Take  me to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three men hang back as The Wolf examines the car. He  studies the car in silence, opening the door, looking ins circling it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me a favor, will ya? Thought I  smelled some coffee in there. Would  you make me a cup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, how do you take it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lotsa cream, lotsa sugar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmie exists. The Wolf continues his examination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About the car, is there anything I  need to know? Does it stall, does it  make a lot of noise, does it smoke,  is there gas in it, anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aside from how it looks, the car's  cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Positive?  Don't get me out on the  road and I find out the brake lights  don't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man, as far as I know, the  motherfucker's tip-top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good enough, let's go back to the  kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmie hands The Wolf a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Jimmie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a sip, then, pacing as he thinks, lays out for t three men the plan of action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay first thing, you two. (meaning Jules and  Vincent) Take the body, stick it in the trunk.  Now Jimmie, this looks to be a pretty  domesticated house. That would lead  me to believe that in the garage or  under the sink, you got a bunch of  cleansers and cleaners and shit like  that, am I correct?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Exactly. Under the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. What I need you two fellas to  do is take those cleaning products  and clean the inside of the car. And  I'm talkin' fast, fast, fast. You  need to go in the backseat, scoop up  all those little pieces of brain and  skull. Get it out of there.  Wipe  down the upholstery В– now when it  comes to upholstery, it don't need  to be spic and span, you don't need  to eat off it. Give it a good once  over. What you need to take care of  are the really messy parts. The pools  of blood that have collected, you  gotta soak that shit up.  But the  windows are a different story.  Them  you really clean. Get the Windex, do  a good job. Now Jimmie, we need to  raid your linen closet. I need  blankets, I need comforters, I need  quilts, I need bedspreads. The thicker  the better, the darker the better.  No whites, can't use 'em. We need to  camouflage the interior of the car.  We're gonna line the front seat and  the backseat and the floor boards  with quilts and blankets. If a cop  stops us and starts stickin' his big  snout in the car, the subterfuge  won't last. But at a glance, the car  will appear to be normal.  Jimmie В–  lead the way, boys В– get to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf and Jimmie turn, heading for the bedroom, leavin Vincent and Jules standing in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after him) A "please" would be nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf stops and turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said a "please" would be nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf takes a step toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set is straight, Buster. I'm not  here to say "please."I'm here to  tell you want to do. And if self- preservation is an instinct you  possess, you better fuckin' do it  and do it quick. I'm here to help. If my help's not appreciated, lotsa  luck gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't that way, Mr. Wolf. Your  help is definitely appreciated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean any disrespect. I just  don't like people barkin' orders at  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm curt with you, it's because  time is a factor. I think fast, I  talk fast, and I need you guys to  act fast if you want to get out of  this. So pretty please, with sugar  on top, clean the fuckin' car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmie's gathering all the bedspreads, quilts and linen h has. The Wolf is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) It's a 1974 Chevy Nova. (pause) White. (pause) Nothin', except for the mess inside. (pause) About twenty minutes. (pause) Nobody who'll be missed. (pause) You're a good man, Joe. See ya soon. (he looks at Jimmie) How we comin', Jimmie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmie comes over with a handful of linen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wolf, you gotta understand  somethin' В–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В– Winston, Jimmie В– please, Winston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta understand something,  Winston. I want to help you guys out  and all, but that's my best linen.  It was a wedding present from my  Uncle Conrad and Aunt Ginny, and  they ain't with us anymore В–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В– let me ask you a question, if you  don't mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you Uncle Conrad and Aunt Ginny  millionaires?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, your Uncle Marsellus is. And  I'm positive if Uncle Conrad and  Aunt Ginny were millionaires, they  would've furnished you with a whole  bedroom set, which your Uncle  Marsellus is more than happy to do. (takes out a roll of  bills) I like oak myself, that's what's in  my bedroom. How 'bout you Jimmie,  you an oak man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oak's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both Jules and Vincent are inside the car cleaning it up. Vincent is in the front seat washing windows, while Jules in the backseat, picking up little pieces of skull and go of brain. Both are twice as bloody as they were before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will never forgive your ass for  this shit. This is some fucked-up  repugnant shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever hear the philosophy  that once a man admits he's wrong,  he's immediately forgiven for all  wrong-doings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, get outta my face with that  shit! The motherfucker who said that  never had to pick up itty-bitty pieces  of skull with his fingers on account  of your dumb ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a threshold, Jules. I got a  threshold for the abuse I'll take.  And you're crossin' it. I'm a race  car and you got me in the red. Redline  7000, that's where you are. Just  know, it's fuckin' dangerous to be  drivin' a race car when it's in the  red. It could blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gettin' ready to blow? I'm a  mushroom-cloud-layin' motherfucker!   Every time my fingers touch brain  I'm "SUPERFLY T.N.T," I'm the "GUNS  OF NAVARONE." I'm what Jimmie Walker  usta talk about. In fact, what the  fuck am I doin' in the back?  You're  the motherfucker should be on brain  detail. We're tradin'. I'm washin'  windows and you're pickin' up this  nigger's skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interior of the car has been cleaned and lined with  bedspreads and quilts. Believe it or not, what looked lik portable slaughterhouse can actually pass for a non-descr vehicle. The Wolf circles the car examining it. Jules and Vincent stand aside, their clothes are literall bloody mess, but they do have a sense of pride in what a  good job they've done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine job, gentlemen. We may get out  of this yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe that's the same car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's not start suckin' each  other's dicks quite yet. Phase one  is complete, clean the car, which  moves us right along to phase two,  clean you two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules and Vincent stand side by side in their black suits covered in blood, in Jimmie's backyard. Jimmie holds a pl Hefty trash bag, while The Wolf holds a garden hose with of those guns nozzles attached.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To your bare ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they follow directions, The Wolf enjoys a smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quickly gentlemen, we got about  fifteen minutes before Jimmie's better- half comes pulling into the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This morning air is some chilly shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure this is absolutely  necessary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what you two look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a couple of guys who just blew  off somebody's head. Yes, strippin'  off those bloody rags is absolutely  necessary. Toss the clothes in Jim's  garbage bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Jimmie, don't do nothin' stupid  like puttin' that out in front of  your house for Elmo the garbage man  to take away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, we're takin' it with  us. Jim, the soap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands the now-naked men a bar of soap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay gentlemen, you're both been to  County before, I'm sure. Here it  comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits the trigger, water SHOOTS OUT, SMACKING both men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn, that water's fuckin' cold!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better you than me, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men, trembling, scrub themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid of the soap, spread  it around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf stops the hose, tossing it on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Towel 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmie tosses them each a towel, which they rub furiously across their bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dry enough, give 'em their  clothes.

dialogues.speaker: FADE UP ON
dialogues.text: JULES AND VINCENT In their tee-shirts and swim trunks. Th look a million miles away from the black-suited, bad-asse we first met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect. Perfect. We couldn't've  planned this better. You guys look  like... what do they look like,  Jimmie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorks. They look like a couple of  dorks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf and Jimmie laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha ha ha. They're your clothes,  motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you just gotta know how to  wear them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, our asses ain't the expert  on wearin' dorky shit that your is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, gentlemen, we're laughin' and  jokin' our way into prison. Don't  make me beg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garbage bag is tossed in the car trunk on top of Marv The Wolf SLAMS is closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, let's get our rules of  the road straight. We're going to a  place called Monster Joe's Truck and  Tow. Monster Joe and his daughter  Raquel are sympathetic to out dilemma.   The place is North Hollywood, so a  few twist and turns aside, we'll be  goin' up Hollywood Way. Now I'll  drive the tainted car. Jules, you  ride with me.  Vincent, you follow  in my Porsche. Now if we cross the  path of any John Q. Laws, nobody  does a fuckin' thing 'til I do  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do shit unless В–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В– unless what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless you do it first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
